page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: THE NAME SOMERSHAM IS SAXON.THE HAM ENDING MEANS SETTLEMENT AND SOMER MAY BE THE NAME OF AN EARLY SAXON LEADER OR MAY DERIVE FROM THE SOUTHMERE OF RAMSEY TO THE N.W. THE PRESENT SETTLEMENT DATES FROM ROMAN-BRITISH TIMES. LISTED BUILDINGS INCLUDE THE C13TH CHURCH (ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST), A NUMBER OF C18TH AND EARLY C19TH DWELLINGS ON THE HIGH ST.,THE C16TH MANOR HALL IN PARKHALL RD.,AS WELL AS A FARMHOUSE AND THE OLD SCHOOL BUILDINGS (1782) IN CHURCH ST. OF FURTHER INTEREST IS A TITHE BARN DATED 1600, AT PRESENT UNDER RENOVATION AND CONVERSION TO SEVERAL DWELLINGS, SITUATED ON THE HIGH ST. WITH A LATE C18TH DOVECOTE TOWARDS ITS REAR NEXT TO THE CHURCH. SOMERSHAM PARK FARM IS ON THE FORMER SITE OF THE BISHOP OF ELY'S PALACE.
